diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with 1 day duration of abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), which became sharp, accompanied by nausea and non-bloody bilious vomiting. No fever or chills were reported, and there was positive anorexia. Physical examination revealed tenderness in the RLQ without rebound or guarding. The clinical presentation and examination findings were suggestive of acute appendicitis.
